p: Eucalyptol (or cineol) 24 is a colourless liquid with a camphor odour, found mainly in the essential oil from eucalyptus ( Figure 5). One of the most abundant sources of cineol are leaves of Eucalyptus globulus. Its content is over 60% accompanied with pinene up to 22% [ 67]. Essential oil is used as flavouring additive in various food products like baked goods, hard candies, meat products and beverages. Due to fresh odour this substance is applied in large quantities in oral hygiene products.
